module.name: JsonWriter
module.short: JSON writer classes for creating JSON files without building in-memory data structures
module.descr: The jsonwriter unit provides classes to create JSON files efficiently without first having to create a JSON data structure in memory. The unit contains two main implementations: TJSONDataWriter which builds a TJSONData tree in memory, and TJSONStreamWriter which writes JSON directly to a stream for memory-efficient processing of large JSON files.

element.name: Classes
element.short: Used for TStream and TStrings classes

element.name: SysUtils
element.short: Used for exception handling and string conversion functions

element.name: fpjson
element.short: Provides JSON data types and string conversion functions

element.name: EJSONWriter
element.short: Exception class for JSON writing errors
element.descr: EJSONWriter is the exception class raised by JSON writer classes when errors occur during JSON writing operations. It inherits from EJSON and is raised for conditions such as attempting to write to an invalid state or stack underflow/overflow conditions.

element.name: TAbstractJSONWriter
element.short: Abstract base class for JSON writers
element.descr: TAbstractJSONWriter is the abstract base class for all JSON writer implementations. It provides the interface for writing JSON data and implements convenience methods for writing properties. Derived classes must implement the abstract methods for actual writing operations.

element.name: TAbstractJSONWriter.WriteValue
element.short: Write a JSON value to the output
element.descr: WriteValue writes a JSON value to the output. This method is overloaded for different data types and has abstract variants that must be implemented by derived classes. The non-abstract variants handle complex types like TStrings and TJSONData by decomposing them into simpler operations.

element.name: TAbstractJSONWriter.WriteValue.aValue
element.short: The value to write to the JSON output

element.name: TAbstractJSONWriter.WriteProperty
element.short: Write a named property to a JSON object
element.descr: WriteProperty writes a named property to a JSON object. This method is overloaded for different data types and automatically handles the property name and value writing sequence. It calls StartProperty, WriteValue, and EndProperty in sequence.

element.name: TAbstractJSONWriter.WriteProperty.aName
element.short: The name of the property

element.name: TAbstractJSONWriter.WriteProperty.aValue
element.short: The value of the property

element.name: TAbstractJSONWriter.StartProperty
element.short: Start writing a property in a JSON object
element.descr: StartProperty begins writing a property in a JSON object. This method must be followed by a WriteValue call and then EndProperty. This is an abstract method that must be implemented by derived classes.

element.name: TAbstractJSONWriter.StartProperty.aName
element.short: The name of the property to start writing

element.name: TAbstractJSONWriter.EndProperty
element.short: End writing a property in a JSON object
element.descr: EndProperty ends writing a property in a JSON object. This method must be called after StartProperty and WriteValue to complete the property writing sequence. This is an abstract method that must be implemented by derived classes.

element.name: TAbstractJSONWriter.StartArray
element.short: Start writing a JSON array
element.descr: StartArray begins writing a JSON array. This method must be followed by zero or more NextElement and WriteValue calls, and then EndArray. This is an abstract method that must be implemented by derived classes.

element.name: TAbstractJSONWriter.EndArray
element.short: End writing a JSON array
element.descr: EndArray ends writing a JSON array. This method must be called after StartArray and any array elements to complete the array writing sequence. This is an abstract method that must be implemented by derived classes.

element.name: TAbstractJSONWriter.NextElement
element.short: Prepare for the next element in a JSON array
element.descr: NextElement prepares for writing the next element in a JSON array. This method should be called before each WriteValue call when writing array elements. This is an abstract method that must be implemented by derived classes.

element.name: TAbstractJSONWriter.StartObject
element.short: Start writing a JSON object
element.descr: StartObject begins writing a JSON object. This method must be followed by zero or more WriteProperty calls, and then EndObject. This is an abstract method that must be implemented by derived classes.

element.name: TAbstractJSONWriter.EndObject
element.short: End writing a JSON object
element.descr: EndObject ends writing a JSON object. This method must be called after StartObject and any object properties to complete the object writing sequence. This is an abstract method that must be implemented by derived classes.

element.name: TAbstractJSONWriter.Flush
element.short: Flush any pending output to the destination
element.descr: Flush ensures that all pending JSON data is written to the destination. This method should be called when the JSON writing is complete or when intermediate flushing is required. This is an abstract method that must be implemented by derived classes.

element.name: TJSONDataWriter
element.short: JSON writer that builds TJSONData tree in memory
element.descr: TJSONDataWriter is a JSON writer implementation that builds a TJSONData tree in memory. This writer maintains an internal stack of JSON objects and arrays and constructs the complete JSON data structure as it writes. The resulting TJSONData can be extracted using ExtractData.

element.name: TJSONDataWriter.destroy
element.short: Destroy the writer and free any created JSON data
element.descr: destroy destroys the TJSONDataWriter instance and frees any JSON data that has not been extracted. If JSON data was created but not extracted using ExtractData, it will be freed to prevent memory leaks.

element.name: TJSONDataWriter.EndArray
element.short: End writing a JSON array
element.descr: EndArray completes the writing of a JSON array by popping the current array from the internal stack. This method must be called after StartArray and any array elements.

element.name: TJSONDataWriter.EndObject
element.short: End writing a JSON object
element.descr: EndObject completes the writing of a JSON object by popping the current object from the internal stack. This method must be called after StartObject and any object properties.

element.name: TJSONDataWriter.EndProperty
element.short: End writing a property in a JSON object
element.descr: EndProperty validates that the current context is appropriate for ending a property. This method must be called after StartProperty and a value has been written.
element.errors: EJSONWriter is raised if the current value is not a structured value.

element.name: TJSONDataWriter.NextElement
element.short: Prepare for the next element in a JSON array
element.descr: NextElement validates that the current context is appropriate for writing the next array element. This method must be called before each value when writing array elements.
element.errors: EJSONWriter is raised if the current value is not a structured value.

element.name: TJSONDataWriter.StartArray
element.short: Start writing a JSON array
element.descr: StartArray creates a new TJSONArray and pushes it onto the internal stack. This method begins the writing of a JSON array structure.

element.name: TJSONDataWriter.StartObject
element.short: Start writing a JSON object
element.descr: StartObject creates a new TJSONObject and pushes it onto the internal stack. This method begins the writing of a JSON object structure.

element.name: TJSONDataWriter.StartProperty
element.short: Start writing a property in a JSON object
element.descr: StartProperty sets the property name for the next value to be written to a JSON object. This method must be followed by a value write operation and EndProperty.
element.errors: EJSONWriter is raised if a property name is already set.

element.name: TJSONDataWriter.StartProperty.aName
element.short: The name of the property to start writing

element.name: TJSONDataWriter.WriteValue
element.short: Write a JSON value to the current position
element.descr: WriteValue creates the appropriate TJSONData subclass instance for the value and pushes it onto the internal stack. This method is overloaded for different data types including Boolean, Integer, Int64, Double, and String.

element.name: TJSONDataWriter.WriteValue.aValue
element.short: The value to write to the JSON output

element.name: TJSONDataWriter.Flush
element.short: Validate the internal state for data extraction
element.descr: Flush validates that JSON data has been created and is available for extraction. This method checks that the internal stack contains valid JSON data before extraction.
element.errors: EJSONWriter is raised if no objects have been created on the stack.

element.name: TJSONDataWriter.ExtractData
element.short: Extract the created JSON data tree
element.descr: ExtractData returns the complete JSON data structure that has been built and transfers ownership to the caller. After calling this method, the writer no longer owns the JSON data, and the caller is responsible for freeing it. This method calls Flush internally to validate the state before extraction.
element.errors: EJSONWriter is raised if no objects have been created on the stack.

element.name: TJSONDataWriter.ExtractData.Result
element.short: The created JSON data structure with ownership transferred to caller

element.name: TJSONStreamWriter
element.short: JSON writer that writes directly to a stream
element.descr: TJSONStreamWriter is a JSON writer implementation that writes JSON text directly to a stream without building an in-memory data structure. This writer is memory-efficient for large JSON files as it streams the output directly. It maintains element counters to properly format arrays and objects with correct comma placement.

element.name: TJSONStreamWriter.create
element.short: Create a new stream writer for the given stream
element.descr: create creates a new TJSONStreamWriter instance that will write JSON output to the specified stream. The stream must be writable and remain valid for the lifetime of the writer instance.

element.name: TJSONStreamWriter.create.aStream
element.short: The stream to write JSON output to

element.name: TJSONStreamWriter.WriteValue
element.short: Write a JSON value directly to the stream
element.descr: WriteValue writes a JSON value directly to the output stream. This method is overloaded for different data types and formats the values according to JSON syntax. String values are properly escaped and quoted according to the StrictStrings property.

element.name: TJSONStreamWriter.WriteValue.aValue
element.short: The value to write to the JSON stream

element.name: TJSONStreamWriter.StartProperty
element.short: Start writing a property in a JSON object
element.descr: StartProperty writes the property name to the stream followed by a colon. If this is not the first property in the object, it automatically adds a comma before the property name. The property name is properly escaped and quoted according to JSON syntax.

element.name: TJSONStreamWriter.StartProperty.aName
element.short: The name of the property to start writing

element.name: TJSONStreamWriter.EndProperty
element.short: End writing a property in a JSON object
element.descr: EndProperty completes the property writing sequence. This method performs no action for stream writers as the property is considered complete after the value is written.

element.name: TJSONStreamWriter.StartArray
element.short: Start writing a JSON array
element.descr: StartArray writes the opening bracket '[' to the stream and initializes element counting for the array. The element counter is used to properly place commas between array elements.

element.name: TJSONStreamWriter.EndArray
element.short: End writing a JSON array
element.descr: EndArray writes the closing bracket ']' to the stream and pops the element counter for the array. This method completes the array writing sequence started with StartArray.

element.name: TJSONStreamWriter.NextElement
element.short: Prepare for the next element in a JSON array
element.descr: NextElement writes a comma to the stream if this is not the first element in the array. This method increments the element counter and ensures proper comma placement between array elements.

element.name: TJSONStreamWriter.StartObject
element.short: Start writing a JSON object
element.descr: StartObject writes the opening brace '{' to the stream and initializes element counting for the object. The element counter is used to properly place commas between object properties.

element.name: TJSONStreamWriter.EndObject
element.short: End writing a JSON object
element.descr: EndObject writes the closing brace '}' to the stream and pops the element counter for the object. This method completes the object writing sequence started with StartObject.

element.name: TJSONStreamWriter.Flush
element.short: Flush any pending output to the stream
element.descr: Flush ensures that all written data is flushed to the underlying stream. For TJSONStreamWriter, this method performs no action as data is written directly to the stream.

element.name: TJSONStreamWriter.StrictStrings
element.short: Control strict JSON string encoding
element.descr: StrictStrings controls whether string encoding follows strict JSON rules. When True, all non-ASCII characters are escaped using Unicode escape sequences. When False, only the minimal required characters are escaped according to JSON syntax.
